ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is a useful class where research techniques across biological research areas are discussed. I would recommend this to students wanting to learn more about biophysics.
I would recommend this course for the experience of being able to work through significant research accomplishments with some of the most intelligent people in the broader field.
This may be the best seminar course you will ever take.it will help you read papers much more thoroughly, and will introduce you to some very cool new techniques.
This class provides a snapshot into the many areas of research of PEB and allows for an in-depth understanding and interesting discussions of the papers of interest.
I would recommend the course to students who want to broaden their research horizons.
For PEB students, I certainly would recommend the course (you have to take it anyway).For other students...sure, but they would probably be in PEB already.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course taught me a lot about experimental and computational techniques used in lab studying varying systems. It was also useful in giving me an opportunity to interact with classmates from different departments.
This experience strongly expanded my knowledge of the broader subject-material pertinent to my interests and research as a PEB student. Greatly enjoyed.
Provided me with a much better understanding of what PEB is.
This class taught me about the benefit of collaborations across disciplines in biological research.
It helped me think about how to communicate with others and really pushed me to engage in the course in a whole different way.
